sentence: According to New York Post reports, three of The Procter & Gamble Company's PG beauty businesses have been auctioned to Coty Inc. COTY for $12 billion.
The three P&G businesses auctioned include hair care, fragrances and cosmetics.
The deal is part of its plan to strengthen its portfolio and streamline the business.
However, the deal has not yet been finalized.
Neither company has yet issued an official statement.
Coty is said to have outbid other potential buyers during the auction.
Coty is known for its perfume for fashion brands Calvin Klein and Marc Jacobs.
The company has a market value of $9.39 billion.
Coty, which has been acquiring several brands for years, will particularly benefit from this deal.
The company will enjoy the huge customer base that P&G has across the globe.
P&G's Beauty segment has remained weak for the past two fiscal years.
Sales declined 2% in both fiscal 2013 and 2014 while volumes remained flat.
Despite growth in the overall market, the company is losing market share due to aggressive competitive activity.
Moreover, the segment continues to underperform in fiscal 2015.
We believe this deal will make P&G a much leaner and stronger company, which should be able to grow faster, create more value and be much easier to manage.
The deal is a part of this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company's strategic plan of portfolio restructuring and simplification, announced in Aug 2014.
As part of the plan, the company aims to focus more on its biggest brands, including the Billion Dollar Brands like Tide, Pampers and Oral-B.
The company will eliminate (partner, divest or discontinue) 60% of the brands (equating to roughly 100 brands) whose sales and profits have been declining over the past three years.
Notably, Procter & Gamble made one other announcement under this plan in May 2015.
The company announced that will it sell its Frédéric Fekkai high-end hair care brand and salons to Designer Parfums and LUXE Brands with the transaction likely to close in June.

(Read: P&G to Divest Premium Fekkai Hair Care Brand and Salons )

At the third-quarter conference call held in April this year, P&G management stated that the company has already divested, discontinued or made plans to consolidate over 40 brands.
Once the divestures are completed, P&G will have a portfolio of about 65 consumer and shopper preferred leading brands that have accounted for 85% of its sales and over 95% of its profits.
We believe that a smaller and more focused company should be able to grow faster, create more value and be much easier to manage.
Better-ranked stocks in the building sector include Unilever NV UN and Unilever plc UL .
Both the companies hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
